reviews.text: This was a fun family activity for the Bend area. Our 9 year old loved seeing all the animals and being able to run around, read and learn. Husband and I also enjoyed all the exhibits, art and fun things to see. Great way to spend a few hours on any given day, and good family fun!

The “cuddle party” (river otters) was the show stealer here. Excellent area with fresh air and plenty of walking exercise as well. The best time to go is after a good snow fall to watch the otters play in it.

This is a nice little stop in Bend at any time of year, especially if you have young ones. There are some animals (my favorite are the birds) and some historical, informative exhibits. There is more outside too! They have a ranch and a changing forest exhibit. It's a decent size museum for being all the way out in Bend. We didn't have any young kids with us so we took about 2 hours at the museum.

As I told my granddaughter, I could go there everyday and just soak in the  beauty of the indoors and outdoors. Every single person we have taken there has been pleasantly surprised by the beauty and quality of the exhibits. We had a wonderful experience today. A young lady who works there spent a great deal of time explaining her education and her job with the animals to us. My only complaint is that the cafe has a very limited menu with high prices.

Good place. Should be fun for kids. We adults didn't have much to see when we went in March. But blame us as we missed a bird show by a few mins. The place is well maintained and has lots of descriptive text to learn from.
A really fun hike and beautiful scenary.

We camp last week my family off-road 42 National Forest and 4280  area that I think is the backside of wickiup reservoir and we really love it and enjoy it. it is also a great place for large families for kayaking, fishing or just relaxing on a hammock.

Beautiful forest but horrible rangers and managment. Power tripping jerks that close more and more trails to ohv use every year. Don't stop to talk to them, they'll find something to pick you apart for. They are there to make your day worse.
The food was unbelievable. I knew they brewed great beer...but good food to boot...what could be better? Very nice place for a meal and a few brews that are not being bottled.

More interested in limiting public use of the land than providing a service.any areas that we used to camp at or use for recreation have now been blocked off under the guise of safety or reclamation. The fact of the matter is, it's just easier to keep the public out.
We had a great time renting Kayaks. The lake is gorgeous and especially Steven was a great help getting the boast in and out of the water as well as helping with tips about the area.
Best spot
Beautiful scenery. Great place for a wedding,  loved the cabin I stayed in,  I would stay again.
Amazing.

Beautiful location fairly secluded. Sitting on a driftwood log soaking my tired feet in the cold water and the warm sun enveloping me. Feels like a lake on top of the world. The volcanic sand is a bit rough, but it will naturally exfoliate your feet. Limited parking, so it could get crowded on a hot day.

Amazing food, beer and service! Chris went above and beyond to make our dinner special after hearing about struggles with a nearby restaurant.  Friendly, funny and gave us his honest recommendations which was perfect! Awesome environment, not too loud but just loud enough to feel lively and exciting.  Our waiter truly made our evening and experience better and we are very grateful! Thanks Chris!

My family and I went to this place as a short stop on the way home and let me say, we made the right choice. Everything we ordered was amazing! From the meatloaf to the steak melt sandwich, one bite assured us that everything was delicious! Plus the wait time was like 5 minutes for 6 dishes.

Great atmosphere, great food, great beer, great service.  I would recommend coming to this destination when visiting. I had their thai spicy chicken wings that were really good for an appetizer. Their fish and chips are some of the best in the industry! Good stop.

Went on a Saturday night. Relatively quick service for how busy it was. Got the elk burger, wings, and the hazy IPA and everything was fantastic. Will definitely be back if I'm in the area. I suggest you stop in if you are too.

Since we’re visiting Bend with our dogs, we had to get take-out. We chose this restaurant by online menu and because many Bend, OR restaurants are closed on Sunday nights. Easy fast friendly service and ordering. All the food was super fresh, tasty, and high quality. Give them a try!!! MAPS: Google Maps kept telling us to turn off of Bond St. onto Oregon St. so we kept making circles. Finally I decided to stay on Bond St. and there was the restaurant about one block past Oregon St. on the Right hand side. Hope this helps! P.S. Pictured are Salmon dinner and the Fish & Chips

Such a pleasant surprise! We went in for a slice. Ordered a full pizza, salad, beer, and wine. Super friendly staff and great pizza. We had the Barn Yard with pulled pork. Really enjoyed the restaurant.

Best slice in Bend! All the pies are delicious, the sandwiches are exceptional, and the best topping of all is the lovely customer service! There is always a small but delicious selection of beer on tap, and I assure you Pizza Mondo is worth the wait. Shout out to the incredible customer service and smile from Jen at the counter. She's funny, nice, and always provides the best customer service even when it's busy! Only complaint is the ranch isn't homemade unlike their other dressings..!

Pizza was good. Place is a bit cramped and seating is hard to come by as the place is usually crowded. They have some outdoor seating but it did not seem sufficient for a weekend crowd. Vegetarian pizzas were good. Crust was well baked and sauce was delicious. Host was gracious to give free coke and garlic knot for delayed order.
Always great pizza.  Always.  Good and great customer service, as well as reasonably priced lunch/after mountain specials.  Couldn't ask for a better pizza place in town.
Best pizza in Bend! Good atmosphere, a variety of people and age groups. A good place for any one.

Good food, friendly atmosphere, convenient location. This is a basic burrito place with good food, nice people,  and quick service. You order at the counter and get your own freshly made chips from the condiment bar. I had a vegan burrito that was amazing.
Most reasonable price for a meal downtown. Plus it's authentic Mexican. A solid choice 👌.
This place is always good. Fast service and solid food. Unless you speak Spanish there isn't much in the way of conversation with the staff but 10/10 the food speaks for itself.
I went in and got their combo enchilada. It had to be the best enchilada I've ever had.  The sauce was amazing and the portion was perfect.  Delicious!
Great food with great prices.  Enjoyed the steak fajitas.  They also have great chips and salsa selection.
Exceptional food, service, and ambiance.  Not one detail was overlooked. I can't say enough good things about this establishment. They truly provided a memorable dining experience.
Great food and staff. The mountain views are spectacular. I am the night salute cook
Amazing views and service.   Our meals were delicious and made to perfection!  Cannot wait to come back again.

Took the wife out for Valentine's dinner as usual and  wanted to find an upscale restaurant with great food and exceptional service. Broken Top Club didn't disappoint !! My wife had the filet Oscar with naked potato and I chose the New york steak and added the Oscar 😁 with a mushroom risotto. For desert we shared a Marionberry cheesecake that was awesome.

Gorgeous golf course was the perfect setting for the wedding we attended. Staff was attentive to guest needs. The lake at the lodge was stunning, as were the wood and stone accents of the building. Good parking area, and even an awesome play structure off the parking lot for kids.

Their ice cream wasn't that good but you would think it was excellent by how much it cost. I've been several times so I can make a sound judgement. You are better off buying a pint of Ben & Jerry's, or Eberhards at the grocery store than buying a cone or shake here. It's not horrible ice cream, but it is definitely not worth what they charge.

Wonderful treats!
Great smells!
Pricey but understandeably so. 
Worth it. :)

I love this place... I havent been on a tour yet this year but I liked the ice cream candy and popcorn they have... I hope you have more cheese popcorn coming in soon you didnt have any when I came.. the ranch popcorn is good... I think I need to get the jalapeno flavor corn for my friends back in California...
Always love Goodys!
This Goody's (on Division St.) is the best one!  Popcorn always tastes fresh, not soggy from sitting out all day. Great selection of ice cream & I love the edible cookie dough!!
Pilot Butte is a beautiful place to hike up in the summer and you can also drive up to the top to see the beautiful view faster!!!
Spectacular 360° Mountainous Veiw!

An awesome view point to see Bend and the mountains covering Bend. Awesome sunset point. Less Parking spots..Go early. It gives details of the mountains which can be seen from there. Could see lot of locals hanging around. Everyone were pretty decent and I could over hear one of them explaining the mountain range.
Excellent place to view the city of Bend and all mountains in the area! There is a cool thing at the top that shows you how far each mountain is from there. You can hike or drive to the top.
I have a daily view from where I live (actually at the base) and everyday is a new adventure of the beauty of God's creation.

Always liked this place but the last time there was very disappointing. Order mistakes, food wasn't as good as usual, and when you complain the coffee is barely warm when they served it and and then they bring you another cup that once again is barely warm it's just disappointing. I'll chalk this one up to a one off issue and will update my rating if my next experience is better. If I based my rating on the last experience it would only be a 2 star rating. Previous experiences would have made it a 4 star rating... Hence the average of 3.

We enjoyed a great dinner at 10 Below. The food was so delicious. I had the crispy chicken and it was piled high with crab♡. My husband loved the crab stuffed shrimp and we had ahi tacos for the appetizer. We will definitely be recommending this place to others.

10 Below is a chic well designed restaurant in the bottom floor of the Oxford hotel. A generous happy hour extends to locally sourced meals, and drinks. They offer a four part $10 lunch that's very tasty. Highly recommend for your next breakfast, lunch, or dinner or simply drinks.
Always like coming here. The prices are decent , the food is good, service is great. I always really like the ambiance
Love this place....been numerous times and never had a bad experience

Amazing food, beer and service! Chris went above and beyond to make our dinner special after hearing about struggles with a nearby restaurant.  Friendly, funny and gave us his honest recommendations which was perfect! Awesome environment, not too loud but just loud enough to feel lively and exciting.  Our waiter truly made our evening and experience better and we are very grateful! Thanks Chris!

Great atmosphere, great food, great beer, great service.  I would recommend coming to this destination when visiting. I had their thai spicy chicken wings that were really good for an appetizer. Their fish and chips are some of the best in the industry! Good stop.

Went on a Saturday night. Relatively quick service for how busy it was. Got the elk burger, wings, and the hazy IPA and everything was fantastic. Will definitely be back if I'm in the area. I suggest you stop in if you are too.

Finally I decided to stay on Bond St. and there was the restaurant about one block past Oregon St. on the Right hand side. Hope this helps! P.S. Pictured are Salmon dinner and the Fish & Chips
